title: Calories in a Poke Bowl
meta_description: Discover calories in a poke bowl, including macros like protein and carbs, plus per-serving nutrition and easy tweaks for variations.
assumptions: Standard poke bowl: 1 cup cooked white rice, 4 oz raw ahi tuna, mixed greens, cucumber, edamame, seaweed, sesame seeds, soy sauce drizzle; no added oils or extras.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by ingredients, portion sizes, fish type, rice amount, and restaurant preparation. Check labels or recipes for accuracy.

quick_answer.text: A standard poke bowl has about 520 kcal, with 30 g protein and 60 g carbs from rice.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged or restaurant info.

tweaks.label: Use salmon instead of tuna per bowl
Low-carb: replace rice with cauliflower rice

faqs.q: How many calories in a poke bowl?
faqs.a: Approximately 520 kcal for a standard serving with rice and tuna.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a poke bowl?
faqs.a: About 30 g, mostly from the fish like ahi tuna.

faqs.q: Are poke bowls high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, around 800 mg due to soy sauce; opt for low-sodium versions to reduce.

faqs.q: How to make a poke bowl lower in calories?
faqs.a: Skip the rice, add more veggies, and use less dressing to cut ~150 kcal.

faqs.q: Does the type of fish affect calories in a poke bowl?
